c74object.name: bufreverse~
c74object.digest: Reverse the contents of a buffer
c74object.description: The bufreverse~ object can be used to reverse the contents of a buffer and write the results to a new buffer.

inlet.description: The process message performs buffer~ reversal

outlet.digest: Bang on completion of the reverse process

method.name: process
method.description:
Syntax: process <symbol: target_buffer> <symbol: source_buffer>
The process message will copy from a 'source' buffer~, reverse the contents and place the result in a new ('target') buffer~.

attribute.name: readchan
attribute.description:
Sets the channel number for buffer~ reading (1-4). If the specified channel does not exist the value is wrapped within the existing number of channels (so 3 will read from channel 1 of a two-channel buffer~, 4 from channel 2).
units: int, default: 1, range: 1..4

attribute.name: resize
attribute.description:
If on, the buffer~ will resize to the necessary size before write. Resizing erases all contents of the buffer~.
Otherwise, output will ONLY happen if there is enough room to write the entire output, leaving the latter contents of the buffer~ and other buffer~ channels unaffected.
units: flag, default: 1, range: 0/1

attribute.name: writechan
attribute.description:
Sets the channel number for buffer~ writing (1-4). If the specified channel does not exist the value is wrapped within the existing number of channels (so 3 will write to channel 1 of a two-channel buffer~, 4 to channel 2).
units: int, default: 1, range: 1..4

c74object.discussion: The bufreverse~ object can be used to reverse the contents of a buffer and write the results to a new buffer. This is a useful utility for multiple buffer processing situations. The hirt.convolutionreverb~ uses bufreverse~ for creating reverse (impulse response) convolution effects.
